metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9555 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The sctp_sf_ootb function in net/sctp/sm_statefuns.c in the Linux kernel before 4.8.8 lacks chunk-length checking for the first chunk, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds slab access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted SCTP data. Andrey Konovalov discovered that the SCTP implementation in the Linux kernel improperly handled validation of incoming data. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9555` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-108-generic - 3.13.0-108.155
linux-image-3.13.0-108-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-108.155
linux-image-3.13.0-108-lowlatency - 3.13.0-108.155
linux-image-3.13.0-108-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-108.155
linux-image-3.13.0-108-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-108.155
linux-image-3.13.0-108-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-108.155
linux-image-3.13.0-108-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-108.155
linux-image-3.13.0-108-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-108.155
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-108-generic - 3.13.0-108.155
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.19.0-80-generic - 3.19.0-80.88~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-80-generic-lpae - 3.19.0-80.88~14.04.1

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-108.155').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-vivid package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.19.0-80.88~14.04.1').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-57.78~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-signed package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-108.155').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-57.78~14.04.1').
